perturbation.original_text:
C. Subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable content agreement with such Licensor, the Net
Advertising Revenue shall be calculated on a quarterly calendar basis (the "Net Advertising
Revenue Period") and shall be payable no later than sixty (60) days after the termination of the
preceding full quarter-annual period, i.e., commencing on the first (1st) day of January, April, July
and October except that the first and last calendar periods may be "short," depending on the effective
date of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
C. Subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable content agreement with such Licensor, the Net
Advertising Revenue shall be calculated on a quarterly calendar basis (the "Net Advertising
Revenue Period") and shall be payable no later than thirty (30) days after the termination of the
preceding full quarter-annual period, i.e., commencing on the first (1st) day of January, April, July
and October except that the first and last calendar periods may be "short," depending on the effective
date of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict by altering the payment deadline for Net Advertising Revenue from sixty (60) days to thirty (30) days. This creates uncertainty regarding when payments are actually due, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
A. This Agreement may be terminated by either party upon thirty (30) days written notice to the other in
the event of a breach of a material provision hereof unless, during that thirty (30) day period, the
party receiving the notice cures the breach.
perturbation.changed_text:
A. This Agreement may be terminated by either party upon ten (10) days written notice to the other in
the event of a breach of a material provision hereof unless, during that ten (10) day period, the
party receiving the notice cures the breach.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction by reducing the cure period for a breach of contract from thirty (30) days to ten (10) days. This directly conflicts with the original clause, making it unclear which period applies and increasing the risk of wrongful termination claims.

perturbation.original_text:
B. COMPANY may, in its unfettered discretion, terminate this Agreement at any time after first giving
CONTENT PROVIDER ten (10) days advance notice thereof.
perturbation.changed_text:
B. COMPANY may, in its unfettered discretion, terminate this Agreement at any time after first giving
CONTENT PROVIDER thirty (30) days advance notice thereof.
perturbation.explanation: This change modifies the advance notice period COMPANY needs to provide CONTENT PROVIDER before terminating the agreement, extending it from ten (10) days to thirty (30) days. This creates a direct conflict with the original clause, potentially causing confusion and disputes about the correct notice period for termination.
